oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Daughters of Union Veterans badge with ribbon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Daughters of Union Veterans badge with silk gross grain red, white and blue ribbon connecting metal with pin. Item belonged to a family from Monroe County, Ky. The Daughters of Union Veterans organized in 1885 to honor and care for Union veterans or their graves. Membership was limited to daughters, granddaughters, or great granddaughters of Union veterans. The "FCL" on the pin badge stands for Fraternity, Charity and Loyalty."
